definition: suddenly have a thought (idiom)/suddenly be inspired to do something
to dash/to move forward quickly/to bulge/to protrude/to break through/to rush out/sudden/Taiwan pr. [tu2]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
odd (number)
strange/odd/weird/wonderful/surprisingly/unusually
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

sentences.english: His latest novel came to him while sitting in traffic in Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 他最新的小說是在坐車時突發奇想，靈光閃現。

sentences.english: On a whim, he called a manager he knew.
sentences.chinese: 他突發奇想，給那裏一個認識的經理打了電話。

sentences.english: I often dance around the house on a whim.
sentences.chinese: 我常常突發奇想，在房子裏舞蹈。

definition: concerted action/to collude (in dishonesty)
(idiom) (of a good outcome) unanticipated/serendipitous/fortuitous
to be prompted by a sudden impulse/carried away by a whim/to have a brainstorm
imaginative/to have one's mind buzzing with ideas
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
whisperings/private words/confidences/sweet nothings
nickname/diminutive/term of endearment/to nickname
inadvertently/unintentionally
lit. to rush at thin air/fig. to miss one's aim/to have nothing to show for one's troubles
to hear (sth said)/one hears (that)/hearsay/listening and speaking
to faint/to swoon/to black out/to become unconscious
(posing a question: whether sb, something) can or cannot?/is able to or not
to come to sb's door/to call on sb
not in good condition/wrong/fishy
to snigger/to titter
online
